item.title: South Korean Lawmakers Agree to Postpone Crypto Tax Launch Until 2027
item.description:
Crypto tax is set to launch in South Korea in January 2027 after lawmakers finally agreed a deal to postpone levies on crypto trading for a further two years.

The post South Korean Lawmakers Agree to Postpone Crypto Tax Launch Until 2027 appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.description:

item.title: Kernel prepatch 6.13-rc1
item.description: Linus has released 6.13-rc1 and closed the merge window for this release. "And for once - possibly the first time ever - it looks like the release cycle doesn't clash horribly up with the holiday season, and we'll have time both to stabilize this release, _and_ the work for 6.14 won't be starting until well into January."

item.title: Matrix Botnet Exploits IoT Devices in Widespread DDoS Botnet Campaign
item.description:

item.title: Critical WordPress Anti-Spam Plugin Flaws Expose 200,000+ Sites to Remote Attacks
item.description:
Two critical security flaws impacting the Spam protection, Anti-Spam, and FireWall plugin for WordPress could allow an unauthenticated attacker to install and enable malicious plugins on susceptible sites and potentially achieve remote code execution.

item.title: 8 Million Android Users Hit by SpyLoan Malware in Loan Apps on Google Play
item.description:
Over a dozen malicious Android apps identified on the Google Play Store that have been collectively downloaded over 8 million times contain malware known as SpyLoan, according to new findings from McAfee Labs.

item.title: INTERPOL Arrests 5,500 in Global Cybercrime Crackdown, Seizes Over $400 Million
item.description:
A global law enforcement operation has led to the arrest of more than 5,500 suspects involved in financial crimes and the seizure of more than $400 million in virtual assets and government-backed currencies.
